Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Psi Corps Promo Card
Description:
Psi Series Card #12

Text says:
The player with this card saved may control all Psi cards use by any opponents. If at any time the player has no bunnies in the Bunny Circle, then this card is discarded.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Psi Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Bunny Eye For The Carrot Guy Promo Card
Description:
Psi Series Card #2

Text says:
Bunny Eye For The Carrot Guy may be used once by a Player to choose a Carrot if he is the player wearing the most clothing with the color that matches the highest die rolled.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Psi Series Promo Cards

Name: Terraforming Mars: Big Box Promos
Description:
A set of 18 project cards, 2 corporation cards and 3 modified replacement cards that were revealed as daily milestones during Terraforming Mars: Big Box Kickstarter campaign.

Corporations: Pharmacy Union, AstroDrill

Project Cards: Advertising, Asteroid Deflection System, Asteroid Hollowing, Comet Aiming, Crash Site Cleanup, Cutting Edge Technology, Directed Impactors, Diversity Support, Field-Capped City, Imported Nutrients, Jovian Embassy, Magnetic Shield, Meat Industry, Meltworks, Mohole Lake, Potatoes. Sub-Crust Measurements, Topsoil Contract

The following cards replace already existing cards so that they place tiles. Those tiles are included in the Big Box, but not in this promo pack. Without the tiles, these cards are unusable; do not replace the already existing cards.  See Community Wiki section for more info.

Replacement Cards: Deimos Down, Great Dam, Magnetic Field Generators

Name: Brexit: Dead in a Ditch
Description:
This game has been designed after extensive research on the Brexit process for my PhD. It aims at simulating as closely as possible while remaining a rather simple (yet big) boardgame the various power shifts that we saw in 2019. (A playtest held a few days before the 2019 general elections saw the Tories win an absolute majority and getting rid of their coalition with the DUP... just sayin')

This is a political game focused on player interactions with half the game revolving around card play inspired by the Sun Tzu boardgame and the other half centered on players negotiating between them how they will vote on the Draft Bills proposed to the floor. It is a long and difficult game that requires a minimum of role playing as players take on specific parties' leadership with specific objectives. It is an asymetrical game where each player has a specific way of winning in order to show the various strategies deployed during 2019 by the real life parties.
The first one is the campaign map. Players compete each turn to gain popularity in 21 constituencies by playing cards and comparing their values. (Similar to the Sun Tzu game's mechanic.) Having more popularity than others gives players a chance to increase their number of Members of Parliament once an election is held. But only the Prime Minister can call for an election, with a little push from the opposition if needed...

The second battleground is parliament. Players propose Draft Bills to vote into the Brexit Deal. Those bills are policies that tackle Brexit-specific issues. Depending on how the issue is tackled and who proposed the bill, the Brexit Deal gets filled up with policies that grant Victory Points to players, or removes some. For that phase, players vote with all the might of their MPs in Parliament. This is why having an election at the right time can completely change the balance of power in the Westminster House of Commons, and change the face of Brexit as a whole !

The final competition takes place around those two phases as players get to play Spin Cards, showing how their political teams spin events and control the political landscape.

—description from the designer

Name: Penny Dreadfun Second Edition: The Great London Adventure
Description:
Penny Dreadfun (Second Edition) is the new game set in Penny Dreadfun universe - made with new and exciting mechanics and art!

Queen Victoria disappeared. Armed with a sword, two axes, throwing knives, and a pistol, she jumped out of the Buckingham’s Palace window, straight into the darkness of the night. The rumours say that the queen was bored and decided to conquer a new colony – Hell itself. There must be something going on because London is getting quite… hot. And there are more and more infernal hounds around and no one to clean after them. And more infernal chasms… and portals… Whew!

It sounds like a true adventure.

Penny Dreadfun: Second Edition will take you to the year 1888, to Victorian England, full of occultism, British humour, and more or less historical characters. You play as one of many unusual heroes, who – driven by various motives – set off to the city to find the source of disaster and save the world,  which is becoming more and more taken over by forces of hell.

Join The Adventure

Action-packed adventure with British humour: Penny 2nd Edition offers various game modes – story driven campaign, co-op boss rush mode and an open world experience. All this takes place in the world of Penny Dreadfun – Victorian England full of geek jokes and crazy historical gags.
But there’s more – Joke’s on You mechanic will blast you with humour… literally. This game will mess with you, or mess you up.

Unique Game System

Penny Dreadfun 2nd Edition is an adventure game where everything is based on your decisions thanks to the unique game system – create your custom hero class deck during the playthrough and use it well to move through London streets, fulfill quests, collect items and plot with encountered characters. Also the fights driven by the PD card system are simple, dynamic and they plays just like rolling dices but without randomness!

New approach to move and board mechanics

With each round the world known to us (or at least to those who are well over 120 years old) is getting more and more infernal. This will be reflected in the constantly changing board with playable 3D elements. That’s a completely new take on the point-to-point move system.

—description from the publisher

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Interview With The Bunnies Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Interview With The Bunnies
Nu 02: This is a double Specialty Bunny. The player with these bunnies down may play two cards per turn.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: The Bunnies Twain Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

The Bunnies Twain
Nu 03: This is a triple Specialty Bunny. The player with these bunnies down may play two cards per turn.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Atlas Shrugged Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Atlas Shrugged
Nu 04: Roll all of the twelve-sided dice in your game. If a number of dice (equal to the number of players) roll any identical number, then all players move to the adjacent seat. For example, if three people are playing, then three of the numbers rolled must be the same. It does not matter what number it is, as long as there are three of them.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Even Stephen, Odd Todd Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Even Stephen, Odd Todd
Nu 05: May be used once by a player who rolls the die. An Even (or Odd) roll allows a player to take an Even (or Odd) numbered Carrot from any opponent or Kaballa’s Market. For example, if a player rolls a 9, then he may take any Odd numbered Carrot from any opponent or Kaballa’s Market.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Journey To The Center Of The Circle Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Journey To The Center Of The Circle
Nu 06: All players must place their five-card hand into a separate pile in the center of The Bunny Circle. All of the cards in the center pile are shuffled, and the player who used the card deals five cards back to each player.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Red October Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Red October
Nu 07: Each player rolls the die in the order of play. Players who roll an Odd number must place one of their bunnies from The Bunny Circle into the Red October while players who roll an Even number may take a bunny out. The player who played the card rolls last and may roll twice.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: The Scarlet Letter Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

The Scarlet Letter
Nu 08: May be used once to force any opponent to discard all cards in his five-card hand that contain the letter 'A' in the title or that have a Red button in the upper left corner (RUN cards). The player decides which option to use. The opponent must show his hand to the player to confirm that he has complied.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: A Tale Of Two Bunnies Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

A Tale Of Two Bunnies
Nu 09: May be given to any opponent with at least two bunnies in The Bunny Circle who must give any two of his bunnies away to other players. The opponent chooses which bunnies to give away and to whom.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Through The Looking Glass Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Through The Looking Glass
Nu 10: May be used once by a player or given to an opponent. Odd rolls increase a player’s Cabbage or Water by the amount rolled while Even numbers decrease the amounts.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: 23 Skidoo Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

23 Skidoo
Nu 11: Allows all players to discard any cards in their five-card hand that have a 2 or a 3 in the Card Identification Number. Players may keep any cards that they wish. New cards are drawn immediately.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: W Is For Whammy! Promo Card
Description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

W Is For Whammy!
Nu 12: May be used once by a player to launch all Weapon cards in his five-card hand at any bunnies in The Bunny Circle. Weapons are launched one at a time directly from the player’s hand. All cards used must be replaced with new cards from the Draw Pile.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo Cards

Name: Yggdrasil Chronicles: Les Voyages de Rig Scenario
Description:
New independent scenario that still uses the campaign mode rules.

French edition found in Plato Magazine 126.

Name: Munchkin Dungeon: Crawling Hand
Description: KS exlusive miniature + 1 card in a separate box.

Name: Munchkin Dungeon: Undead Horse
Description: KS exlusive miniature + 1 card in a separate box.

Name: Crazy Kitties
Description:
Crazy Kitties is a fun, fast paced, card shedding game. Each round is lightning quick and the game is easy to learn and crazy to play. Crazy Kitties is a family friendly game that is a great way to spend an evening with friends or family.

Cover the laser pointer, clap the ball of yarn, knock the glass of water or stick the opponent with a card draw... or 10!

Embrace your kitty mentality and play out of turn if you have an exact copy of the last card played.

There are 3 different types of kitties, spotted, striped and solid, and 7 different types of cards in each suit. On top of that, there are 2 wild cards for a total of 23 different Crazy Kitties! 108 cards in total.

—description from the designer

Name: Mobil Ball-
Description:
Football simulation from 1949.

Players alternate using their cards to move the ball in the opponent's goal.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Crud Creek Nosepickers – Snotlings Bowl Team
Description:
Snotlings have long admired the game of Blood Bowl from the sidelines, but rarely have they taken to the pitch for… obvious reasons. Well all that’s about to change, as the “Mighty” Crud Creek Nosepickers have blasted down the barriers to bravely (or foolishly) pave the way for their diminutive kin. They're ready to flood the gridiron with a squirming, stinking wave of pint-sized players, along with all the zany contraptions and silly tricks they could dream up in their mushroom-addled brains.

While Snotlings may make Halfling teams look downright athletic, and Goblins seem burly in comparison, what these little blighters have in spades is, well, lots more of themselves! They're so small and energetic, the refs can never keep count of how many are on the field at once! Their numerical advantage, combined with a willingness to bend and break the rules, makes them very unpredictable indeed. In short, Snotlings are all about the sort of wild shenanigans that make Blood Bowl an absolute pleasure to play. Not only are they fun, but they have some devious tricks that can actually win a game from time to time, quite literally keeping your opponent on their toes.

This multipart plastic kit contains all the components you'll need to build the Crud Creek Nosepickers, a Snotling team for use in games of Blood Bowl, containing 12 Snotlings, 2 Snotling Fungus Flingas, 2 Snotling Fun-Hoppas, 2 Snotling Stilty Runnas, and 2 Snotling Pump Wagons! You'll also find 2 turn counters, 2 coins, 4 Snotling-themed balls, 20x 25mm bases, and 2x 32mm bases with holes.

-Key Features-
Flood the field with scrappy underdogs
Rush the pitch with Pump Wagons!
Cheat to win, and have an absolute blas

—description from the publisher

Name: Mean Streets: War in Gang-infested Cities
Description:
Mean Streets: War in Gang-infested Cities is a simple, fast-play set of wargame rules for fighting gang battles in the city streets of today, the recent past, or 19th century. 
It recreates the romanticized look at street gangs from movies like the 1979 cult classic, The Warriors, or West Side Story. 
Each player controls a street gang composed of 5-12 figures, with each figure representing one man. 
Gangs can be assigned a huge variety of missions to earn victory points while engaging in "rumbles" with rival street gangs. 
Mean Streets includes experience point rules for a continuing series of games, and a complete set of campaign rules to allow players' gangs to wage street battles for control of their city. 
Extensive scenario design rules and primary and secondary missions assist players in setting up their own games.

A bibliography gives players inspirational books, movies, and blogs to read to help them create their own world, making it as Hollywood or realistic and gritty as they desire.

—description from the publisher

Name: After The Raid: French And Indian Wars
Description:
"After The Raid: French And Indian Wars"

After raiding an enemy settlement a small group of Rangers are fleeing through the forest pursued by lots of angry local.

A quick and simple wargame needing only a few figures ideally 28mm but any size of individually based figures will do. 
The Rangers have to reach the far table edge and safety the Indians have to stop them.

Comes with plenty of sample stats for the figures to ensure lots of variety in each game and to keep the players guessing about what they will face.

—description from the publisher

Name: Crusader vs Skeleton: A Micro Chapbook Wargame
Description:
A necromancer has raised a great Skeleton Army. 
The righteous army of the crusaders are determined to thwart this unholy evil. 
Who will win?

Crusader Vs Skeleton is a Micro Chapbook Wargame--an ultra-light miniatures skirmish game that fits in a single folded chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Micro Chapbook Wargame.

These rules are specially designed for solo play but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a one on one miniatures game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook Wargames for extra options!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tom's Party
Description:
Today is Tom the mouse's birthday and his friends are preparing a surprise birthday party. Place the different elements and guests in the party before Tom appears. If he arrives early, quickly release a ballon so that he can linger to play with it, and you'll have time to finish the surprise.

Cooperation game.
All the guests and elements of the party are inside of a bag, all the players, one by one, should extract one wooden piece from the bag, if it's a guest or an element, we are preparing the party, but if we take Tom, then we use one of the four balloons then he can linger to play with it. We have 4 balloons.
If we can put all the guest before we use the four balloons, then we win, otherwise we lose.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bearzzz
Description:
Mmmm, the honey's delicious. Help Little Bear to take 5 pots of honey from the kitchen while Mummy Bear sleeps on her rocking chair. But be careful, because some noises could make Mummy Bear wake up and catch us.

Roll the dice to know the color of the cards we should flip, if it's a honey pot, Great!!, if it's something which make noise, Carefull!!, because that could make Mummy Bear wake up, but if we flip the card with no noise, then Mummy Bear will sleeps again.
We will win if we get all the honey pots before bear Mum wake up, otherwise, we lose.
It's a cooperation game for 2+

Name: Abandon All Artichokes: Rhubarb Promo
Description:
Set of six Rhubarb cards for the game Abandon All Artichokes.

Compost this card to refresh the Garden Row, then harvest a card (Place old cards under Garden Stack.)

Name: Chaf Chof
Description:
Chaf Chof is a game of agility and vistual speed. Throw the dice and be the quickest to find the card with the same combination of the animals or colours. You can play with colours or shapes and the instructions also include a playing variant from 2 years old.
If the combination of colours or animals is not on the table, the first one who see it, can say it and take this card from the deck of the player who took it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bed Bugs
Description:
There's a plague of bed bugs in teh house and we have to trap them with our different body parts, even if we end up in almost impossible positions. But if you also want to win more points you'll have to perform the action that appears on the card without dropping any bed bugs. Don't stay in your seat!
In each card you can see where you should put the bed bugs in your body, the first one to put the bed bugs in the correct place, should ring the bell and can decide if he win this card or want to win extra card doing the action of the extra card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Brutal Tender
Description:
CONTEXT
Imagine a rainbow Ring with nice things running all over in it. It's full of cuteness, except that there should only be one when the rain stops reflecting the sunlight. A bit like when the cops â€‹â€‹charge at gay pride, the color gives way to the horror ... and you can then smell the scent of death, wet of course like it just rained. It's kind of a Royal Rumble of the Nice things, the last one that survives, survives, and the others ...
 Note that these nice things eat so much corn that they poop popcorn in each square when they leave. Unfortunately for them, but fortunately for the show, it is so GMO the corn that when there is too much concentration on a small surface, well it poops the Bad thing!

HOW TO PLAY
- Move your TENDER in the Ring and poop CORN in each square you leave
- Form pentagrams with your CORN in order to poop your BRUTAL
- Use GUTS from wounded TENDER in order to poop more brutal BRUTAL
- Kill other TENDER with your BRUTAL before they kill you

CONTENT
Print and Play Game
1 RING
4 TENDER
8 BRUTAL
7 WEAPONS
64 CORNS & 1 DOUBLE CORN
7 GUTS
RULES BOOKLET

This game exist in two sides:
Brutal Dinos Tender Unicorns & Brutal Unicorns Tender Dinos. It's up to you to decide who will be the helpless beings!

—description from the publisher

Name: Crazy Food
Description:
In Crazy Food you have to be the quickest to grab the food needed to solve the puzzle on each card.
Work out the next in the sequence and gab the fruit before anyone else
The first to get five points wins.
Each card has a sequence, the first who take the correct color or shape of the fruit to continue the sequence win one point.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monkey's Forest
Description:
Become a monkey and collect as much fruit as you can and brint it to your tree, but be careful with the transport, as the more you bring, the more danger these is of one of them falling on the way there.
Thru the dice and take one or two fruits, lose one fruit or win extra fruit in your pile, you win the fruits when you bring them to your tree.
Win who has more fruits in his tree.

—description from the publisher

Name: Emo Park
Description:
Action and observation game, using the  you must describe the cards using the emotions, but without suing the prohibited words, the first one to find the scene on the board, will win the card.
Also, you'll find some recommendations for using this game with adults (parents, educators, ...)

—description from the publisher

Name: Ring Win
Description:
Find the right animal before the others and put it into the compound.
Be the quickest to find the animals which have escaped from the farm, take them back and put them in the compound. Hold them firmly, because if you drop them you'll lose the card.
Flip one card with animal and another with color, the first player find it and ring the bell, win the card and should put it in his body as per card instructions.
The winner is who has 5 cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Memorizzers
Description:
New observation game which use the classic board game and App.
Different categories and levels of difficult depending on the age of the players. All can play with the same options to win.
The App shows one picture during few seconds, you should remember all the details and answer the question of the app.
Win who arrives first at the end of the board answering the questions of the app.

Name: Modular Parcheesi
Description:
The modules mean up to 8 players can take part in the most fun positions. The 2 octogonal centran anchoring pieces mean that two different groups can play at the same time.
The instructions are the same as for the classic version of Parcheesi, though if only two people are playing we recomment halving the score when you get "home" and when you land your opponent.
The cards of the pieces are reversible, with numbers on one side (for 8 players version) and non on the other, for when pieces are removed on reducing the number of players.

Name: Pingüi Land
Description:
All of us have to make sure that Pingüi reaches the iceberg before the snow monster in order to escape the island and not get caught in the avalanche.
Cooperation game, to win the game, we should bring the penguin to the Iceberg before the avalanche catch us or before the Snow Monster arrives to the Iceberg before the penguin.

Name: Sam the villain
Description:
In Sam the Villain, all the players are the police and we have to catch the thief before he commits his last 4 robberies and scapes to a lost island with all his loot.
Cooperation game.
Each player roll his dice and has 1 minute to find his object in the board, if he find it, then can help the rest of the players to find their own objects, but using only words to describe the situation.

Name: Pirates Adventure
Description:
Which team of shipwrecked pirates will arrive first to the island and will build a pirate ship to continue on with their adventures?
Two pirate ships have been shipwrecked and its crew has to get to an island that they see in the distance and try to build a new ship to be able to return home.
Each team should pass the challenges as paint, define or imitate, if they pass the challenge, win a coin, at the end of the road, if the team has 10 coins, can buy the pieces to build the ship.
In this game, the board is the floor of the house and the chips are the players.

Name: How Am I Weird
Description:
How Am I Weird is a simple, fun party game to play with family and friends, in a group of 3 - 10. There are LIFE cards, COMEBACK cards and blank WEIRDO cards. LIFE cards present situations, sometimes awkward or embarrassing, sometimes annoying or familiar. COMEBACK cards present responses that are weird and wonderful. One person is nominated the Big Weird Chief, and the rest of the players each take 8 COMEBACK cards and one blank WEIRDO card. The Big Weird Chief reads a LIFE card. Each player chooses the weirdest and funniest COMEBACK response, or comes up with their own answer using their WEIRDO card! The person who gives the weirdest and funniest answer wins that round. At the end of the game, the player who has won the most rounds wins the game, and becomes ruler of the universe. Then you should WEAR THE CROWN!

—description from the publisher

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Bunny's Eleven Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Bunny's Eleven 
Omega 01: Allows a player to steal the winnings from any opponent who is successful at either the Carrot Top Casino or Casino Royale (Orange Booster Deck). A roll of 7 or 11 doubles the winnings.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Numberella
Description:
Numberella is table top game involving cards, wooden Antcoins, jewels, dice and a sand timer. The game is based around a combination of arithmetic / word problem / stacking questions, on Game Cards - correct answers earn you Antcoins - and luck, which comes from Fortune Cards.

Fortune cards allow players to hijack each other's turns, (Harry Hijack) get money from the bank,(Jin Genie) make each other miss their goes,(Miss A. Go) and steal each other's money (The Thief.) A blocking card (Ronnie Resist) allows players to defend themselves. You get a new fortune card every time you cash in 100 Antcoins with the bank. Fortune cards are also interspersed with game cards. The person with the most money when the time is up, wins.

The aim of the game is to have fun and get better at math. The game is based around the UK and US math curricula, and as such is suitable for use in an educational setting. It is available in 3 Levels of difficulty.

It has become curriculum for gifted students in some US counties, but it is also widely used in Special Ed / SEND classrooms, including psychiatric homes.

—description from the designer

Name: Virtual Reef Diver
Description:
Experience the beauty and wonder of the Great Barrier Reef while learning about the dangers this national treasure currently faces, and the solutions data scientists are providing for its defence. Work as a team of citizen scientists on a quest to classify the corals, identify the organisms, and help protect the seventh wonder of the natural world.

The game features fast paced gameplay (pick a card and identify it for points), beautiful reef imagery and educational content.

Sales of this game directly contribute towards future print runs of this game as it is a not for profit.

Virtual Reef Diver is based on an Australian Government-funded citizen science website, where people can go to play a digital version and contribute useful data to scientists across Australia and across the world!

Whether for teaching, learning or just for fun, Virtual Reef Diver has plenty to offer everyone.

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: The Djarnak Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

The Djarnak
Omega 02: May be placed between any two adjacent players and prevents each from using any aggressive cards (cards with a pink box) against each other.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Go With The Flo Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Go With The Flo
Omega 03: Allows a player to exchange any saved Special (or Very Special) card for Carrot #04 (Flo).
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: The Conch Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

The Conch
Omega 04: May be used once by a player to silence all opponents for two rounds of play. Only the player holding The Conch may speak (and therefore make deals or exchanges of any kind).
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Lord Of The Bunnies Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Lord Of The Bunnies
Omega 05: Specialty Bunny or Super Specialty (OUT OF PRINT): The player with these bunnies down (in The Bunny Circle) may play two cards per turn. All other Specialty Bunny cards in The Bunny Circle are eliminated.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Number Six Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Number Six
Omega 06: Celebrity Bunny: This is a single Celebrity Bunny. Players that have three or more down may play two cards per turn.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: No Supe For You Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

No Supe For You
Omega 07: May be used once by a player to eliminate all Super Bunnies from The Bunny Circle that are the same color as any die which rolled an even number. Good luck getting even!
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Hare E. Potter Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Hare E. Potter
Omega 08: May be used once by a player to retrieve the Magic Spatula or any Magic Fountain card from the discard. The retrieved card may be used immediately or saved.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Dago Bunny Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Dago Bunny
Omega 09: May be used as a Green Bunny and stops all weapons directly targeting any Kinder Bunnies that a player has in The Bunny Circle.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Baby Bunnies On Board Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Baby Bunnies On Board
Omega 10: When a player has this card saved and at least one Kinder Bunny down in The Bunny Circle then any time he must roll a die (or dice) of a specific color, this card allows the player to roll both the 10 and 12-sided dice of the same color and to choose which roll to use.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Red Herring Pink Salmon Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Red Herring Pink Salmon
Omega 11: May be used once by a player to counteract the death of any Red or Pink bunny. May be used at any time!
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Bunnies of the Caribbean Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Bunnies of the Caribbean
Omega 12: May be used once by a player to steal the amount of Dolla rolled from any one opponent. Only the exact amount may be taken.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Omega Thirteen Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot.

Omega Thirteen
Omega 13: May be used once by a player to force any one die roll by any player to be re-rolled. May be used at any time!
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: I Dream of Bunny Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot.

I Dream of Bunny
Omega 14: May be used once by a player with no bunnies in play to take any one bunny from the Discard Pile and to place it directly into The Bunny Circle.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Kubrickian Glee Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot.

Kubrickian Glee
Omega 15: May be used once by a player and given to any opponent who must kill at least one bunny before he may choose a Carrot.
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Soft Kitty Warm Kitty Promo Card
Description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot.

Soft Kitty Warm Kitty
Omega 16: May be used once by a player to immediately cure all bunnies in The Bunny Circle of any sickness or hunger. May be used at any time!
Families: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards

Name: Quartermaster General WW2: Total War
Description:
Total War is the first expansion for the second edition of Quartermaster General, that provides players with a great number of new playing options, without dramatically increasing the play time.

Among these new game features, the most important is the introduction of Air Forces that brings a whole new dimension to the conflict. Air Forces help the players to defend Armies and Navies in the same space, or to attack adjacent Air Forces in battle.

Another new key feature is the presence of new forces: Chinese and French forces, that enlarge and change the opening setup, introducing many new strategies. A new tactical point is introduced into the game through Bolster cards, a new type of cards that are played directly from the hand as reactions to game play. “Last but not least”, the introduction of new alternate “what if” cards, that represent historical strategies that were considered but never executed, as Operation Sea Lion, the invasion of Britain.

With these important changes the game is still simple to learn and quick to setup, but these new tactical moves at player’s disposal in this expansion set increase the fun and ensure a further and greater replayability!

—description from the publisher

Name: Los Cazapedidos
Description:
Los Cazapedidos is a card game where up to four players face off to see who is the chef who gets the most points at the end of the game.
To win you must be the fastest to gather and combine ingredients to complete orders with references from pop culture elements like movies, TV series and video games; use the chef cards to gain advantage or annoy your opponents; and be careful with event cards that change the rules of the game.
A easy-to-learn game to play with family and friends.
So, if you've got 15 minutes to spare and you want to have fun playing in company, who you gonna call? Los Cazapedidos!

Name: Het Auris Verhalenspel
Description: In this cooperative game each round one player is the storyteller. He or she selects one of three storyline options on four consecutive story cards. Then the other players as a group have to guess which options the storyteller has chosen. The storyteller then reveals how many, buy not which choices were guessed right. Now the group can use communication cards, which asks the storyteller to give a hint - a word, a drawing, a musical hint, etc. After that, the group has to guess again. This is repeated until the right combination of story line options is guessed. Now another player becomes storyteller. Every story fully guessed right, earns a point. When there are no more communication cards, the game is over.

Name: Tile Up
Description:
Tile Up is a fiendishly clever strategy game. Players try to score points by creating shapes out of their tiles that match goal cards. Easy enough, right? Not so fast! You can only place tiles on top of other tiles if the two tiles are different colors and the tile on top has a lower number than the tiles it is covering. The player with the most points at the end of the game, when the four corners of the gameboard have been covered with tiles, wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – Solo Campaign Deck
Description:
The Run Fight or Die Solo Campaign allows you to play through a one player adventure using a base game copy of Run Fight or Die: Reloaded. The campaign spans four missions where you’ll need to gain the Followers, Leadership Points and Loot necessary to eventually defeat the Mutant Zombie, all while avoiding traumas that will hinder your efforts.

Contains:

     15 Action Cards
     15 Trauma Cards
     4 Upgrade Cards
     2 Mission Reference Cards
     1 Supply Cache Card
     1 Experience Card


Note: This was included in the Run Fight or Die: Reloaded â€“ Kickstarter Edition, but is sold separately for Retail editions via the publisher's website.

Name: The Battle of Mimigawa 1578
Description:
Mimigawa is a battle fought on 10 December 1578 between the ÅŒtomo clan and Shimazu clans. It ended in a decisive Shimazu victory.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Mimigawa

In 1578, Sorin Otomo, who was the largest Sengoku Daimyo in Kyushu, protected Asahi Ito, who had lost Hyuga after the Shimazu invasion. In an attempt to recapture Hyuga and expand the power of Christianity, he attacked. Shimazu forces pushed forward the army of Otomo's army and crossed the Ogawa.

Battle of Mimikawa is a wargame on the Shimazu vs. Otomo battle, also known as the Battle of Takashirogawa.

This game adopts the chit driven system in which "activating chits" are assigned to each unit of both sides. It reproduces medieval battles where actions can be uncontroled.

Game scale

        1 hex = approx. 100 m
        1 unit = 250-500 soldiers


Number of players = 2ã€€
    Play time = 120 minutes

Contents (excluding magazines)

        160 pieces (15mm square)
        1 map (1 A1 size)
        1 rule book (12 pages)


(adapted and translated from Command Japan website)

Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #153

Name: Flugten til Rødovre
Description:
It is the 1980s and the Cold War has turned hot. As civil authorities can you facilitate the evacuation of Copenhagen prior to an expected nuclear attack.

Cooperative game about the evacuation of 90,000 people from Copenhagen before the bombs begin to fall.

—user summary

Name: Arena: The Contest – Dragon Collection
Description:
The Dragon Collection comes with five masterfully-sculpted Dragons that add several new game play options to Arena: the Contest.

New dragon-related scenarios and stories
Embark on Dragon Queen multi-mission super sidequest in Tanares Adventures
Control Dragons in Quests, as if they were Heroes
Play Dragon vs. Dragon (PvP) Game Mode
New Boss Spells to use in all Boss Fights
Compatible with Arena: the Contest, Tanares Adventures, and future Dragori games
Adds new Attack Cards, Bosspads, Gameplay, Quests, and Miniatures for each of the five Dragons.

Name: The 7th Continent: The Veins of the Earth
Description:
Delve deep below the Continent in order to unlock its secret and triumph over the Evil consuming you. Your actions will be limited as the current draws you ever deeper.

—description from the publisher

You do not need this expansion if you already have the collector's edition (white box) of the What Goes Up, Must Come Down expansion from the Kickstarter campaign.

Name: The 7th Continent: A Prison of Clouds
Description:
Fly over the continent aboard a Hot-Air Balloon, in search of salvation. With each trip, hunger, confinement and strong headwinds will test your limits!

—description from the publisher

This expansion contains a brand-new curse, allowing you to explore the skies above the continent in a hot-air balloon. You do not need this expansion if you already have the What Goes Up, Must Come Down expansion from the Kickstarter campaign.

Name: The 7th Continent: Forgotten Passages
Description:
New characters, new states and skills, alternative cards for terrains, events, items, states, food, etc. You thought you’d seen it all? Think again!

—description from the publisher

This expansion includes many of the stretch goals that were originally included in the "What Goes Up, Must Come Down" expansion's Kickstarter campaign. You do not need this expansion if you already have the What Goes Up, Must Come Down (white box) from the Kickstarter campaign.

Name: VainGlorious: France 1940
Description:
VainGlorious: France 1940
Wargaming rules for 1:1 land battles with air support.

Recreate the events of May 10th to June 22nd 1940 with these classically styled but neatly tweaked rules.

     Works with all figure scales
     Suits battles between a few platoons of infantry and tanks
     Hit & damage rolled into one
     Simultaneous & alternating phases where appropriate
     Data tables use vehicle & weapon specifications
     Uses percentage dice or equivalent
     Covers Belgian, British, Dutch, French & German materiel
     Random events and other solo-friendly mechanics
     Includes Bulson scenario and Stonne mini-campaign


—description from the publisher

Name: Cafe Christa
Description: A co-operative dice-and-cards board game wherein players collaborate to try and serve customers at a cafe each course of their meal in order. Dedicated to the memory of the designer's daughter, an accomplished chef and baker. It can also be played solo.

Name: Entirely Plausible Journey
Description:
The Phlegbonian Ambassador is ill and the fate of the universe hangs in the balance!

This is a sci-fi space opera with a difference.  
Instead of cruising the outer reaches, Space Patrol will be shrunk down to microscopic size to battle a disease that is killing the alien physiology of the ambassador.

The scenarios are written as a supplement for Quick Intermediate Level Skirmish, free rule set.  
Designer's notes and guidelines help port the game to any game system you want.  
There are also suggestions on how to tweak the scenario with hints and tips learned tweaking the scenario during playtest.

It contains:

     Scenario with simple rules to create a dynamic, challenging alien physiology
     Simple print and play terrain bits so you can run the game rightr away
     Loads of playtested suggestions for variants, so it's the scenario that keeps on giving


—description from the publisher

Name: Madinah Salat Fun Game
Description: A Muslim board-game that reinforces the steps towards completing the required daily prayers, published by Goodword Books as part of a set that also includes the Hajj Fun Game. Move around the board while answering trivia questions to continue - there are no dice, to prevent running afoul of traditionalists who dislike games of chance.

Name: Charty Party: All Ages Edition
Description:
The absurdly funny game of ridiculous charts!

If you like bizarre charts, goofy card games, and want a fresh game for your next party night, give Charty Party a try!

How to play?

Every player draw 7 cards
All the players choose a judge from themselves, who will draw a chart card.
Everyone play a card by passing it face-down to the judge. Choose the funniest card which fits with the chart card.
The judge chooses the funniest card related to the chart card, giving one point to the owner of the card.
You can play the number of rounds you want. At the end, the player with the most points win the game!

—description from the designer

Name: Unlikely Heroes: Pharaohs
Description:
Unlikely Heroes: Pharaohs is a puzzling narrative adventure game in which the unlikely heroes must adventure through three unique quests of undead, magic, and mummies: The Lost Mummy, The Desert Bride, and The Sphinx.

Unlikely heroes must explore the map, encounter challenges, and ultimately save the day. Start the game by flipping the first map tile and exploring each corner of the map. As more and more tiles are uncovered, your team will encounter puzzles, enemies, treasures, tools, weapons, and allies. Decipher the narrative and explore the map accordingly for victory.

Box contents
50+ page Adventure book
200+ Gamecards
20 x Acrylic cubes
4 x Meeples
Rulebook

Name: Gears: The Deck-builder
Description:
"In the before time, darkness ruled our lands. But evil was conquered and colors started to shine upon our city. We became adventures and took to the skies. We became adventures and took to the skies."

"Play the cards to your advantage, hinder your opponents and use your special abilities at the right momement."

Gears is an aggressive push-your-luck deck-builder for two players. Every turn, you can either activate actions, gain power or give despair.

Shuffle the gear-cards together and deal 5 cards to the middle of the table to form the market row. From here, you can buy or gain new cards throughout the game. Deal 10 starter cards to each player and draw 5 cards into your hand. The best fixer at the table, is the starting player. Play cards each turn to activate actions, gain power or give despair to your opponents. Push your luck and resolve for dominance. When a player has 2 dominance, that player is the winner.

Name: Who are the Legends?
Description:
Who are the Legends? is a fast-paced, competitive, educational card game not just for kids but also for all ages. Kids will learn about our history’s greatest scientists, artists, leaders and other historical figures that  changed the world while having fun and engaged in a friendly competition.

Quick Overview

The objective of the game is to have the most poits to win. Earn points by matching Clue Card with Character Card and showing it to everyone or Play. Everyone will check the cards if properly matched by  using the Info Cards. If the Played cards are correct, the player will gain 1 Score Token of the corresponding Clue Card from the Pile. At the end of each round, the player with the highest score will receive a Seal of Excellence. The first player to collect (2) two Seal of Excellence wins the game.

This card game aims to teach our younger generation while they are engaged in a friendly competition. This card game is focused on exhibiting our history’s greatest scientists, artists, leaders, and other historical figures that changed the world. Our basic system play style; this game is design for kids so that they can learn while having fun.  You can play with family and friends in the comfort of your home or even at school.
And much more… When you invest in a copy of our game, you are not just providing your children years of entertainment – you are also investing in their future.  It’s our mission to change the way of playing, It’s our mission to educate children while playing a game that is suitable for them.

Let’s do it together! Who are the Legends Card Game is seeking your support so we can achieve our mission and spread the game into the global Market!

—description from the publisher

Name: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults – Twin Attack Armory Pack: Knight Gatling Gun vs. Orc Twin Crossbow
Description: Expand your Knights vs Orc Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults battles with this three expansion for the Battleground: Crosbows & Catapults game.

Name: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults – Twin Attack Armory Pack: Knight Trebuchet vs. Orc Mortar
Description: Expand your Knights vs Orc Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults battles with this three expansion for the Battleground: Crosbows & Catapults game.

Name: Villagers: Playmat & Promo Cards
Description:
A full colour 30x70cm edge bound neoprene playmat for Villagers.

Also includes:
PROMO PACK 1 - two new villagers and a solo mode reminder card.
REPLACEMENT CARDS - five cards to replace misprints from the first edition of Villagers.
—description from the publisher

The Villagers Playmats come bundled with promo cards and a replacement card pack. It is made of fabric-covered neoprene and helps to keep the road organised while making it easier to pick up cards. It measures 30 x 70cm and has a bound edge with rounded corners.

The Promo Pack adds two copies each of two new solitary villagers, the Plower and the Scribe, which can be used at any player count - just shuffle them into your deck and go! There's also a player aid card for the single player mode to help you get to grips with the solo turn structure.

The replacement cards correct some small errors from the first print run of Villagers.

Name: Urbe: For the King
Description:
Urbe: For the King is a fast and fun tile placement game where the players will compete to create the most beautiful and well organized City, trying to obey to the Royal Decrees issued from His Majesty, the King.

Each player will represent a Guildmaster who will try to be the most influential on the Kingdom using their specific tools, Coin Cards, to outperform the other Guilds in creating the most efficient and beautiful City for His Majesty.

By gaining City Tiles through placing their Emissaries and wittingly using Coin Cards, players will try to beco­me the best builder, thus being appointed by the King himself.

Fountains will enrich the City as new neighbourhoods are built, so you will be able to surprise the King creating even more beautiful Cities than he required.

-description from publisher's website

Name: La Bataille de Hagelberg 1813
Description:
La Bataille de Hagelberg, 1813 recreates a neglected but key battle in, what was then considered, Brandenburg during the opening of the fall German campaign in 1813. The French commander, General Jean-Baptiste Girard, was commanding the Magdeburg Garrison and had been asked to support Marshal Oudinot in his drive towards Berlin. He was faced by a mainly Landwehr force commanded by Prussian General Karl Friedrich von Hirschfeld and supported by the Cossack General Alexandr Chernyshev. The Prussians and the Russians were given the task of stopping Girard’s French from joining Oudinot’s army.

The Battle of Hagelberg was a bitter battle, held on the same day as the Battle of Dresden. Though the casualties were high on both sides, the Coalition prevailed and stopped Girard from affecting a union of the French forces approaching Berlin.

Notes:
1. Use the Premier Rules, with combat and fire charts, and markers from previous ME releases.
2. First available on Marshal enterprise website as Print and Play. Printed map and counters later contained in La Bataille de Berlin 1813.
Families: Series: La Bataille (Marshal Enterprises / Clash of Arms Games)

Name: Tommy's wereldspel
Description:
In this game you have to deliver packages around the world. You start with only a small van which can only hold one package, later on in the game you can buy a truck, which holds three packages, and a plane with room for two, but which can travel a lot further. Each turn you throw two dies to determine what you are allowed to do this turn: drive (this includes flying), get a new deliverance order, get a quality card, or choose one of the above. The world map is divided in squares, each square costs hunderd euros to travel over. Each deliverance order costs you a starting fee, but once you delivered the goods, you get paid.
The first person who maken 50.000 euros wind the game.

Content: game board - play money - 40 shipments - 12 game pieces - 12 transport tokens - 4 depots - 4 petrol stations - 4 player cards - 54 quality cards - 56 shipment cards - 2 dice - game rules.

Name: Novgorod: Neue Ziele
Description:
Novgorod: Neue Ziele introduces new objects in every game for more strategic depth in Novgorod. Two double-sided boards show prerequisites for awards you can get when you complete an object, awards such as more seals during the game end scoring or benefits during the game like one-time income or permanent additional privileges. Be quick, though, as each award is available only once.

If you fail to complete an object on each board, you lose points at the end of the game.

Name: Novgorod: Neue Bürger
Description:
New citizens are coming to town!

When you add Novgorod: Neue Bürger to the Novgorod base game, sixteen citizens are dealt to the players. Place a citizen in a city you visit, and later visits will gain more income. Three citizens are replaced by a patrician that gains you seals when you produce luxury goods in that town.

If you do not take part in church building in your hometown, you will lose points in the game end scoring. The earlier you donate money to the church, the cheaper it is — but you need the money more urgently in the beginning, don't you?

Name: TOBITO
Description:
TOBITO is a pure abstract strategy game for multiple players. The goal is simple: Move your three pieces to the three spaces on the opposite side of the board before your opponents can do so. Players may jump over opposing pieces, which they then relocate. You will find it's not easy to progress at times because of your opponent's movement and re-location of your pieces.

Each player has three colored pieces with reversible faces to show their goal sign. Each player sets their three pieces, plain color up, on their three starting spaces. A turn is made by moving one of your pieces. Passing your turn isn't allowed.

You can move any one of your pieces to an unoccupied space in any of eight directions (horizontally, vertically or diagonally). You may move a piece by jumping over any number of adjacent pieces, whether your own or an opponent's, onto a vacant space. When jumped, your pieces stay where they are, but opposing pieces must be relocated to a vacant space.

Once a piece reaches the goal, you flip it over, and that piece is now immobile. You can't move it, and opposing players can't jump over it because it can't be relocated.

At the end of your turn, if you haven't won and all of your starting spaces are occupied with pieces — whether yours or others — you are out of the game. If more than one player remains in the game, remove all of your pieces from the board. Continue the game to determine the winner.

The first player to move their three pieces to the opposite side of the board or the last active player still in the game wins.

Name: Lampogo 3
Description: Collect as many cards as you can by solving the maths puzzles. You can play with the SUM cards, the DIFFERENCE cards or the MIX cards, which combine the two in a single puzzle. There are also three ways to play, race, team or solo.

Name: Hadara: New Nations
Description:
5 new start cards for Hadara with bonuses and other value distribution.
You can use them individually or combined with the old ones.

The cards were in the Spielbox issue 3/2020, the instructions are on page 54.

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Glow in the Dark Cthulhu
Description:
180mm tall Cthulhu cast in Glow-in-the-dark plastic. Available as a special add-on in the Onslaught 2 Kickstarter campaign (one had to register for the Petersen Games newsletter before the Kickstarter launch). Later available from Petersen Games, and comes with its own rules and abilities as a neutral Great Old One.

CW-GLO1

Name: Santa Monica: Dead Reckoning Promo Card
Description:
Promo card for Santa Monica to celebrate the release of AEG's Kickstarter Dead Reckoning.  With this card, scurvy pirates take away one of your residents or tourists, but if you can then get someone to where X marks the spot, you'll find a treasure trove of sand dollars, the currency in the game.

—description from the publisher

Originally intended as a print and play according to AEG (the manufacturer):  “By popular demand, a way to get the printed versions of the print-and-play pirate-themed promo cards we made for other AEG games to celebrate Dead Reckoning.“

This was a Kickstarter exclusive promo card available for add-on purchase, from the Dead Reckoning Campaign.

Print and Play available here:

https://www.alderac.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Santa-Monica-Promo-Card.pdf

Name: Tiny Towns: Fortune – Pirate's Den
Description:
The pirate parrots have come to Tiny Towns!  Add this new card to your Tiny Towns games to celebrate the release of AEG's new title Dead Reckoning on Kickstarter!

The pirate parrots seek to expand their control of Tiny Towns.  They play the green building, and become more valuable the larger their area of buildings becomes. Not only that, they give you coins which help when playing with the Fortune expansion.  Those parrots can't help but chase the shiny gold!

Card text:  2 (plus) if adjacent to a Green House. When constructed gain 1 coin  for each Green House you have in play (including this one)

—description from the publisher

Name: Bop It Beats
Description:
A DJ musical addition to the Bop It line where players must Spin It, Scratch It, Flip It, and of course Bop It to the beat. Contains actual tracks from EDM artists that are synchronized to the game play.

—description from the designer

The original English version of the game had a bug in the DJ Expert and DJ Lights Only mode on which you reach to a 6 command pattern and the game will say that you failed. A demonstration of the bug can be watched here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xve3SOH6gBo&ab_channel=SamLocke

The only way to bypass the bug is to play either a foreign version of the game or to play it on DJ Party as demonstraed here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ylo-Y18bXMY&ab_channel=SamLocke

Name: The Cards of Cthulhu
Description:
The Cards of Cthulhu (PnP Version) is a single player thematic card game for use with a standard deck of playing cards and some six-sided dice. It was developed by Ian Richard for the 24 Hour Contest in November 2012.

Cards are divided into Cultists (numbered cards), Horrors (royal cards), and Planetary Alignments (aces). Each suit represents a different cult trying to summon an Elder God.

Each round of gameplay proceeds in two phases, drawing a card and placing it within its respective cult and engaging in combat with dice. Cultists may be defeated by corresponding numerical combinations of dice. Horrors must be resolved first and require special dice combinations. An additional card is drawn for each Planetary Alignment that comes into play. Defeated cards serve as trophies that may be traded for artifacts and spells that improve the chances of success.

The game ends if five Cultists of any suit come into play at the same time to summon an Elder God or you successfully play all cards in the deck while preventing this from happening.

Name: Galleys, Guns and Glory!
Description:
Galleys Guns and Glory! is designed to play table top naval battles with fleets of cannon packing oared vessels, in a time frame from roughly 1500- 1650. The rules are designed to work at “convention level”, which means you can learn the rules in less than 5 minutes, get into action- making a couple of n00b moves,(or spectacular maneuvers) and come away with a story or two to tell at the bar.

Management of each ship and its crew are visual and easy to account for as the crew and damage to the ship are represented on the models- leaving little to no paperwork!

Although trying to capture the essence of the period and referencing strongly the doctrines and tactics of the time, I claim no absolute historical accuracy, other than like the galleys of yore my ships are made of wood and are adorned with such opulent awnings, lanterns, flags and bulwark side trim that would make the Sultan’s harem jealous.

Galleys Guns and Glory! is designed for oared naval actions ranging in scale from small corsair raids of a few ships to “epic” grand battle re-fights such as Lepanto- with over 100 ships! With an emphasis on maneuvering, the brutality of gun fire, sky darkening fusillades of small arms and intense melee boarding actions that would ebb and flow across ships, GGG! has something for everyone!

—description from the designer

Name: Puckspil
Description:
Play according to A or B:

A: Players take turns to place one of their pucks (using the elastic) in one of the three scoring areas. The player with the most points after 4 puck throws wins the game.

B:The nine pucks are stacked in piles of 3 an placed at the coloured point areas. Players take turns trying to knock down the entire pile in one attempt. Points are rewarded for packs landed inside the point area.

Name: Frosch und Fliege
Description:
"Fridolin-Spiele in der Tüte" Nr. 8 (between 1921-1928)

The frogs sit on the four green spaces. The flys start at the upper left corner. Each player has five flys, but only one of them in play at any time. If a fly gets eaten or catched the player starts with the next one. If a player gets a fly on the nose of the human figure in the center of the game board,he wins the game. Movement is determinet with a special fling die, a handle with three numbered discs (1-3 on the front side and a blank back) on a string.

If a fly gets on a space with a frog it gets eaten. On a blue space the fly is caught by the human. If a fly gets on a red space it at once advances along the arrow to the next yellow space.

If a player flings a 6 he shouts "Quak Quak", flings again and moves a frog of his choice. If the frog lands on a fly, the fly gets eaten.

—user summary

Name: Saddam Moves South
Description:
Saddam Moves South (SMS) is an operational level two player wargame covering a hypothetical Iraqi invasion of Saudi Arabia in 1990. The assumption here is that after the Iraqi army overran Kuwait in the first week of August 1990, Saddam Hussein continued the offensive to grab the vital oilfields of Saudi Arabia. In response, the United States leads a coalition of states to stop the Iraqis and then retake lost territories.

The game system is based on that of Desert One War, which models ground, air and amphibious operations. For the Coalition, the central game system is Air Transport Points (ATP) which represent strategic airlift capability. The assumption is that the scenarios cover the opening stage of an intervention, before the US can mobilize full-scale sealift. Therefore, airlift will become the primary means for moving units into the theater and providing logistical support.

The Iraqis are closer to their lines of communications, but their ability to conduct sustained offensives is restricted by planning and logistical considerations, modeled in the game by making the capture of certain objectives a prerequisite for sustaining their offensive. Another factor is that the decisive mobile campaign which the Coalition conducted in 1991 was in part the result of extensive preparation of the theater of operations via logistical buildup, intelligence and in-theater training during the period August 1990 to January 1991. The campaign in the game models the situation where the Coalition must build up in the face of a continuing Iraqi offensive.

Published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #339 Mar-Apr 2023

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 3-10 days
Hex: 21.75 miles / 35 kilometers
Units: Group to Division

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (228 9/16" counters - with 4 blank counters included)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15 hours

Note: Players will need to provide one 6-sided die for game play.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
